meanings.definition: A medical procedure in which a flexible tube with a light and camera is used to examine the inside of a body cavity or organ.
meanings.sent1: The doctor performed endoscopies to check the patient's stomach for any issues.
meanings.sent2: She had to undergo multiple endoscopies to monitor her digestive system.
meanings.sent3: During the endoscopies, the camera accidentally captured a funny face made by the patient.
meanings.sent4: The endoscopies were like tiny explorers venturing into the mysterious caves of the body.
meanings.sent5: The endoscopies revealed a world within the patient that was previously unseen.

meanings.sent1: The hospital had state-of-the-art equipment for performing endoscopies.
meanings.sent2: The doctor reviewed the records of all the endoscopies conducted last month.
meanings.sent3: The endoscopies lined up in the storage room, ready for their next assignment.
meanings.sent4: Each of the endoscopies provided valuable insights into the patients' health.
meanings.sent5: The endoscopies were essential tools in modern medical examinations.
